subject: Sales
title: The Takeaway Close
description: A 60-second lesson on The Takeaway Close.

hook.text: An agent says 'This home might not be right for you.' Suddenly the buyer wants it even more.

buildup.text: The takeaway close removes the option. When something is pulled away, desire spikes instantly.

discovery.text: It triggers reactance: the urge to reclaim freedom when a choice suddenly feels threatened.

twist.text: Overuse turns it manipulative. One well-timed takeaway is powerful. Three in a row is a game.

climax.text: Use it sparingly and honestly. Sometimes pulling back genuinely saves the deal and builds trust.

punchline.text: Sometimes pulling back is the strongest close.

quiz.question: What psychological principle drives the takeaway close?
